programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi hope for more good luck as the buyers return to San Diego, while Ivy comes across a cross-dressing locker.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys are keen to win a climate-controlled unit stuffed with contemporary art, but they have some competition. Plus, Clinton has a hunch about a quad bike.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones take a tactical approach to secure a big result at a storage auction, after spotting fishing tackle, a boat motor and instruments in a pair of units.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Puffy in the Sky with Diamonds
programme.desc: Victor plans to get the better of the competition with some dirty tricks, while one of the teams buys a locker that could prove highly profitable.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Surgeon, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: A locker auction in Texas is in the path of a tornado, so the bidders try to complete their purchases before the storm hits.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A new picker goes out on his first trip, while Rick tries to fix up a 1950s ice cream cart.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick gets the chance to restore a Nasa jet pack signed by Buzz Aldrin and a client brings in a Second World War bomb.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The swamp faces the biggest storm since Hurricane Katrina, and before it arrives, the teams race to tag as many alligators as possible.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Family members struggle to cope with an invasion on their home, while a blood-sucking pest feasts upon local village church-goers.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: A hedgehog is killed, but only a pair of tooth marks is left as evidence. Plus, local estate agents plan an open house but a critter undermines their selling attempts.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a 1939 Superman doll, while Corey has a jam on a 1952 Fender Telecaster.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare Rolling Stones record spins into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether it meets Rick's satisfaction.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds clash when a man brings in an angry pet alligator he wants rid of. Les has to keep his composure to avoid making a bad decision.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions mount when a man loses his temper over a mix-up with his gold chain. Meanwhile, an allegedly cursed relic scares Ashley.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The movement known as Ancient Astronaut Theory, which was sparked by Erich von Daniken, Swiss author of several books which make controversial claims about extraterrestrial influences on early human culture.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about UFOs, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files held in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar 1, suggesting that US government cover-ups occurred.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba compete against Victor to buy a luxury household locker in an auction at Mineral Wells.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The team visits an auction in Irving, where Victor buys a secret agent's locker and Bubba tries to sell some explicit art.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee shocks the family by turning violent, and Ashley loses her temper when someone tries to steal her underwear.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and his father clash when Les's idea turns dangerous, and Ashley embarks on a new in-house business venture.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chum check out a water-propelled jetpack and a statue of the Hindu god Shiva is brought into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rescue buoy from the set of Baywatch signed by David Hasselhoff is brought in, as well as two flintlock blunderbuss pistols. Rick and Corey check out a six-person solar bike.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Man in Black Is Back in Black
programme.desc: Dave Hester returns to the auction circuit, Darrell tries to get Brandon into shape, and Jarrod and Brandi's latest purchase leads them on a wild ride.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Mogul's Return
programme.desc: Jarrod goes bidding with a hangover which Brandi fears will hold him back, while Dave will not let a fight with Laura keep him away from an auction.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones endure disappointment at an auction, but hope a container they have secured at another site will make their day worthwhile.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Storage auction enthusiasts in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, are not pleased when Allen Haff and Ton Jones arrive in town searching for bargains.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders have a mysterious new rival at an auction in the historical town of DeSoto, where a collection of Willie Nelson memorabilia is up for sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor manages to turn Bubba against Ricky at an auction in a wealthy suburb of Dallas.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at how a three-man crew on DHL A300 battled against the plane's failing hydraulics as a routine mail flight turned into a fight for their lives.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about UFOs, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files hidden away in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar One which suggest that cover-ups and conspiracy theories have concealed the secrets for decades. As well as delving into cases where UFOs have chased commercial flights, the series tries to understand what the US government might be hiding from its people.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Considering whether ancient rulers had otherworldly links. Experts examine whether history's most powerful leaders were 'chosen' and guided by aliens.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff fight over whether they should buy a batch of venomous reptiles, and an incident forces Les to seek a new head of security.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tells a frightening story of a hold-up at his grandfather's store, and a dominatrix brings her gear into the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff at the Detroit family pawn shop encounter a gynaecologist's table and an elephant's skull.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les challenges Seth to a high-stakes sales competition, but later faces the most dangerous customer he has ever encountered.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: A Miami auction presents Ton Jones and Allen Haff with a big score, including a Delta Relay Rocket and a camouflage hovercraft, but they struggle to make a good profit.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Chicago, where they find a 1984 Yamaha snowmobile, a rare autographed baseball glove and a 1950s Robby the Robot toy.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Encounter At An Abandoned Asylum & More
programme.desc: A paranormal expert gets a shock when an entity strikes. A driver spots a UFO and ghosts are captured at a marijuana dispensary.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts investigate reported sightings of strange flying objects and mysterious lights in the sky, questioning whether they could be signs of extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary learns a harsh lesson about Dave at auctions in Rancho Palos Verdes, California, while Rene puts a secret strategy to the test.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary is forced far out of her comfort zone when the buyers head to Indio, California. Lockers in this desert town hold many treasures, but it remains to be seen who will buy them.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Jen Brister, Rob Beckett and Lou Sanders are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies challenges his five fearful funny people to entertain him by completing more baffling challenges, which this week involve corneas, crackers and construction.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Rhod Gilbert takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with writer, director and satirist Armando Iannucci and playwright Lucy Prebble joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by comedians Dara O Briain, Chris Addison, Sean Lock and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. The host asks questions about things that are horrible, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Go 8 Bit: DLC
programme.desc: Go 8 Bit's resident games expert Ellie Gibson decides whether the Guardian's games editor Keith Stuart's favourite title is worthy of entering her Hall of Game.

programme.title: Go 8 Bit: DLC
programme.desc: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit's companion show, hosted by Go 8 Bit's resident games expert Ellie Gibson with team captains Steve McNeil and Sam Pamphilon.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle attempt to come up with a next level surfboard to add to the Hawaiian's history book.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick journeys to Berlin to reinvent himself with help from Game of Thrones actress Gemma Whelan, in a multi-cultural weekend full of Currywurst and Korean barbeques.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick returns to his family home town of St Albans for waffles with bacon, followed by a visit to his parents' house for his mum's prawn lasagne.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys uncover a once-in-a-lifetime find and must decide to go big or go home. Mike gets down-and-dirty to rescue an old piece from Mother Nature.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Tempers flare between Brandon and his wife Lori as the bidding at an auction soon escalates.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori team up with Jesse McClure, but they are not sure he can be trusted.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys have an awkward encounter with the 'King of the Gypsies', who has an incredible underground stash but insists he cannot be bought.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: When Frank goes nuts for a century-old snack icon, he must decide if it is worth an unprecedented sum of money to take it home.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Peter meets his match with a client. Beat and Andre trade a viewing platform for Motocross lessons, and Brian creates the tree fort of his childhood dreams.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson spares no expense when he tests the BMW X6. James May joins Margaret Calvert, one of Britain's road-sign designers, to test-drive the Vauxhall Insignia VXR, and Richard Hammond tries out a Â£340,000 Lexus supercar. Plus, musician Seasick Steve is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Inspector Dave Corcoran calls on his friend to turn what looks like a tug boat into a police vessel. Meanwhile, the team fix up a car whose tyres were slashed whilst on duty.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier leads two teams of car buffs in an engineering contest against pro-driver Shane Lynch's supercar. This time, they take on the iconic Land Rover Discovery in an off-road hill climb. To defeat such a thoroughbred, the teams need to demonstrate their innovation and imagination.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May head to New Zealand to take part in a race along the coastline to the tip of the North Island - with one behind the wheel of a car and the other in an America's Cup yacht. Back in the UK, Richard Hammond tries out three hot hatches as he puts the Renaultsport Clio 200, Peugeot 208 GTi and Ford Fiesta ST through their paces, and a host of stars including Warwick Davis, Charles Dance and Joss Stone assemble at the test track to welcome a new Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of the Ferrari F12 Berlinetta, sampling the punch of its 730bhp V12 engine on the open roads of Scotland. Richard Hammond harnesses the power of motorsport on a quest to find the world's best taxi, and James May pays tribute to the former BBC Television Centre in White City, London, using a motorcyclist and a pair of parkour runners. Plus, the BAC Mono - an astonishingly fast car with just one seat - is put through its paces on the test track, and film director Ron Howard goes for a spin in the new Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Phil Wang makes sure his outstanding outfit leaves even less to the imagination than it did before and Jessica Knappett demonstrates her mastery of a child's percussion instrument.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and actor Rob Delaney, presenter Davina McCall and actor and musician Laurence Fox to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include people who order starters, 12-string guitars and cyclists wearing Lycra.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites boxer Nicola Adams, comedian Frankie Boyle and comedy actress Diane Morgan to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include magicians, losing one's keys and life itself.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the topical quiz, with Radio 4's The News Quiz host Miles Jupp and journalist Quentin Letts joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests Sandi Toksvig, John Lloyd, Johnny Vegas and regular panellist Alan Davies for the quiz with a difference. The host asks the teams to consider hypothetical questions, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan, Tessa Coates, Charlie Brooker and Shappi Khorsandi are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit
programme.desc: Team captains Steve McNeil and Sam Pamphilon are joined by Josh Widdicombe and Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock to play Defender, Love You To Bits and Football Manager 2017.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. The first episode features the accounts of Polish inmates held there prior to the Holocaust, Jewish survivors and a former SS officer, who discusses being placed in charge of a firing squad.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: British physicist Colin Humphreys attempts to find the real route of the Exodus and the true mountain of God.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attend questions why spirals are so widespread in nature. He gleans some answers by examining the narwhal's tusk and the spiral shells found on snails and ammonites, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: The fall of Jericho, in which Joshua and his men lay siege on the fortified city for seven days. Then they blew their trumpets and its walls came crashing down. The Israelites razed the city, killing every man, woman and child. It's a fantastic Biblical tale of victory through faith, but is there any truth behind the story?.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: The life of Mary Magdalene, a key figure in Christianity, having witnessed Jesus' death and resurrection.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: The use of propaganda in Hitler's Nazi regime. The first episode examines the Fuehrer's fascination with propaganda, which began in the trenches of the First World War.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. The first episode features the accounts of Polish inmates held there prior to the Holocaust, Jewish survivors and a former SS officer, who discusses being placed in charge of a firing squad.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador..

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson joins an unprecedented archaeological expedition to Belgium in search of a perfectly preserved WWI bunker called the Vampire..

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. He begins with a towpath exploration of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Setting off from Liverpool, he takes a three-day walk inland to Wigan, ending at the town's iconic pier as he traces the story of the waterway's chaotic construction and its impact on the development of Lancashire.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: The decade of propaganda, impassioned speeches, newspaper articles, posters and campaigning that all led to one moment - Hitler being made Chancellor of Germany in January 1933.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Despite later claiming he was only following orders, Hoess was instrumental in the development of Auschwitz for mass murder, arranging for Soviet prisoners to be brought in as construction workers and scouring Europe for more victims to kill. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Independent, a skyscraper in Austin, Texas. At a height of 690ft, it is the tallest building in the city, surpassing the 683ft Austonian, another residential skyscraper.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd is horrified to learn that Carl Mackenzie, the man accused of a shopping centre massacre, has been granted the right to appeal. Refusing to believe the wrong man was convicted, he throws himself into the case, but when the squad unearths new evidence that supports Mackenzie's claim, it also leads to the discovery of some disturbing truths about their superior officer. Trevor Eve stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Honey can't bring herself to contemplate the terrifying prospect that fiance Scott might have murdered his first wife, despite Yvonne and Steve's suspicions that there might be something to Greg's allegations. Lance tries to get the Cole Lane Estate's teenage population interested in cricket, hoping to bridge the generation gap and recruit informers at the same time, but his best efforts are jeopardised when Gary sets up a bungled drugs bust.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: After the threat of closure, the refurbished station reopens - and welcomes two fresh members of staff. Young Billy Rae's inexperience presents a problem, but the Blue Watch have more difficulties learning to trust fellow newcomer Geoff Pearce.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy remains in hospital, and his friends are told that he may never recover his sight, while Marsha Stubbs' involvement with a local businessman leads to a brush with the law.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The regiment's tour in Germany is cut short. Meanwhile, a prank in the Officer's Mess causes trouble for Tucker. Starring Robson Green and Rob Spendlove.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Honey can't bring herself to contemplate the terrifying prospect that fiance Scott might have murdered his first wife, despite Yvonne and Steve's suspicions that there might be something to Greg's allegations. Lance tries to get the Cole Lane Estate's teenage population interested in cricket, hoping to bridge the generation gap and recruit informers at the same time, but his best efforts are jeopardised when Gary sets up a bungled drugs bust.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Adrian Edmondson guest stars as a colleague of Ric's from Ghana, who can't resist meddling in other cases and performs a heart transplant on a patient Michael had declared ineligible - to the delight of his gold-digging wife. Mubbs asks Lisa to move in with him but she proves reluctant, and Diane advises Tricia to tell Chrissie the truth about Frank - not realising the full extent of her secrets.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An accident in A&E persuades Adam to reveal his secret to Sam - an unlikely choice for a confidant given their recent inability to see eye-to-eye. Charlie tries to help a rape victim brought to his attention by her distraught husband - who is immediately viewed with suspicion by Tina.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Dan Casper arrives at Sun Hill, and immediately risks life and limb to rescue a girl attempting to kill herself on a dual carriageway. Unfortunately, despite his best efforts, the case has a tragic ending. Scott manipulates Honey into setting a date for their wedding, and Gina tells Smithy she's suffering from cancer, while Gary makes himself unpopular by criticising the boys in uniform.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sam's new friend Clive pushes his luck and visits the Vic. Kathy takes positive action to deal with a recurring problem from the past. And the trial of Nick Cotton finally begins.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nick Cotton watches as the prosecution case is made, and Dot faces Eddie's father. Meanwhile, Ian has a confession to make to Kathy.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch team is called to a suspected arson attack on a run-down council estate. Later, a young boy is found handcuffed to a bench by a river.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Hector is so incensed by the sudden arrival of his pregnant daughter Lizzie that he decides to disown her. Meanwhile, Archie races to reconcile his feuding family, and Katrina faces a difficult decision. Light-hearted Scottish drama, starring Richard Briers and Susan Hampshire.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim bids a temporary farewell to the familiar surroundings of his beloved Jersey and ventures into the heart of London to investigate a kidnapping. Crime drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey feels he has to tell his mother he is in debt to the tune of Â£20,000, and the whole family are required to help him out.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The Yellowcoats fight to save Fred's horses from the glue factory - with unexpected results. Comedy, starring Felix Bowness.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean calls on Alistair's help to do a spot of match-making and Lionel finds himself in the middle of a muddle. Comedy, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Mother of All Mistakes - Or Is It?
programme.desc: Hobbo discovers the whereabouts of his real mother and decides to pay her a visit, but is unimpressed by the welcome he receives. Marina chains herself to a supermarket trolley in protest against the unreliability of men, while Nelly reveals some information that greatly lifts Hobbo's spirits.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: A forgetful clock-mender contacts the sleuth when he becomes the target of a couple of small-time crooks. Armed with advice from DCI Adams, Hetty starts her investigation at a video store and soon discovers that there is more to the case than meets the eye.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: When Graham King's wife Shirley is murdered in an explosion that almost claims Peregrine too, the investigation heats up and exposes a maze of fraudulent activity.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The inclusion of a letter in a late actor's biography reopens an old case for the team - but reliving the past threatens to be too much for the widow who was accidentally responsible for his death. DAC Strickland's cocky nephew lends his assistance, but his affections for Sandra bring out the worst in Gerry and Brian. Dexter Fletcher guest stars.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is called in to investigate when a convicted killer is cleared of the murder of his adoptive father on appeal. Not fully convinced the man is innocent, Boyd tries to find the rest of the family to establish the truth, but when he does eventually track the relatives down, he realises they have a lot to hide. Drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose.

programme.title: Sky News Tonight With Dermot Murnaghan
programme.desc: Dermot Murnaghan brings perspective to the day's national and international news, with in-depth reporting, interviews, analysis from our specialist correspondents and lively debate.

programme.desc: Dermot Murnaghan brings perspective to the day's national and international news, with in-depth reporting, interviews, analysis from our specialist correspondents and lively debate.

programme.title: Sky News at 9

programme.title: Sky News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's leading stories with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Tyson Fury: The Gypsy King
programme.desc: Following a tougher than expected contest against Otto Wallin, Tyson's father John is critical of trainer Ben Davison, and Fury's team eventually part ways with the trainer as his rematch with Deontay Wilder is finally confirmed. Before the contract is signed for his fight with Wilder, the boxer also takes part in a lucrative WWE bout in Saudi Arabia against Braun Strowman.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef's culinary tour of France leads him to the diverse and distinct region of the Camargue, a natural region located south of Arles. James begins at Les Marquises, the Laurent family's farm, where he learns about the Camargue bull, and barbecues local fish for the family. Later, he visits a rice farm and cooks a risotto using his own rice-brewed beer.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.sub-title: ITV News Special: The Chancellor's Budget
programme.desc: Nina Hossain presents live coverage of Chancellor Rishi Sunak's Budget Statement, as ITV News correspondents and guests analyse what it means for individuals and for the nation's finances.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present the second day of the prestigious festival, including feature race the 3.30 Betway Queen Mother Champion Steeple Chase, plus races at 2.10, 2.50 and 4.10. With analysis from AP McCoy and Ruby Walsh, reports from Alice Plunkett, Brian Gleeson, Luke Harvey and Mick Fitzgerald, betting news from Matt Chapman, social stable thoughts from Oli Bell and Chris Hughes, fashion updates by Mark Heyes and Charlotte Hawkins and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the arcade-themed quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win the chance to scoop a Â£10,000 jackpot. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Andrew, Joe, Sara and Paddy pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Scottish Liberal Democrats.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain faces up to Malone and soon realises he is not to be messed with, Vanessa feels it is time to tell everyone about her diagnosis. Samson is over the moon when Sam asks him to do an important job.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ali assures Ryan that Gary, or someone hired by Windass, must have spiked his drink, and Alya confronts Geoff about her belief he is behind the nasty online reviews for Speed Daal. Aggie reveals that they've had several calls from newspapers wanting to get James's side of the story.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp goes on a camping trip to Brownsea Island with his family, where he plans to catch and cook dinner for the whole family. After taking his grandson fishing, he heads for a cookery masterclass with head chef of the nearby Rick Stein restaurant. The next day, Harry and his son, Jamie Redknapp, compete in a game of crazy golf.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: James lies to his Manager and Press Officer and assures them he is not gay, and Ali takes Maria on a terrifying car ride. Meanwhile, Nina wonders if Roy's ashamed to be seen with her after claiming the meeting with the bat group has been cancelled.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Maggie wants to apologise to everyone she has upset, and decides to go and visit GP Carol Tomlin. The radio interview has gone viral and the village is left reeling from the revelations. Jill bonds with other fellow members of the 'outed six', Marcus and Roxanna. Meanwhile, Neil and Kelly embrace what was broadcast and pretend that they are lottery winners, and later, Maggie discovers the truth about Dr Carol's marriage. Starring Dawn French, Mark Heap, Chetna Pandya, Vicki Pepperdine and Emily Reid.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex processes involved in creating modern-day paving stones. Plus, the construction of a traditionally tailored tuxedo suit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes to France in search of a retro Citroen HY Van, but mechanic Edd China is not impressed with his spoils, knowing it will be a costly renovation.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Trucking legend Steve and his dog Bella take a huge load cross-country from Alice Springs to Perth. Meanwhile, engine issues see Russell struggle to hit a delivery deadline.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The OCC mechanics design and build a 'motocoaster' bike for a theme park, and the Teutuls head west for a reunion and a guest appearance on My Name Is Earl.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Ben wants a partial restoration for his father's 1962 Maserati, but the stakes are raised when Dan reveals its value. Plus, a pair of VW fans want to revive their '66 Beetle.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to Pennsylvania to make bologna, starting by cutting off fat and clots from the meat, packing it and getting it ready for the smokehouse.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Oil and Encaustic Paints/Marine Plywood/Cycling Shoes
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as the series reveals how oil and encaustic paints, marine plywood and cycling shoes are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as the series reveals discover how paper fans, walnut oil and copper are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in turning goat fleeces into fabrics, building a quad bike that turns into a jet ski, and creating a harp.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's travel all over America in search of the most interesting, rare and profit-bringing treasures, from old bangers to classic toys.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crab season gets off to a bad start as skippers Keith Colburn and Phil Harris await the results of medical tests, while repairs to some of the boats leave the owners in debt.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: As the season's midway point passes, some dredges struggle to make a profit, captains are challenged by uncooperative crews and relationships are tested.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Trucking legend Steve and his dog Bella take a huge load cross-country from Alice Springs to Perth. Meanwhile, engine issues see Russell struggle to hit a delivery deadline.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer manages to find an inexpensive MGB GT in urgent need of repair and enlists the help of mechanic Edd China to restore it to its former glory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The MGB GT restoration continues as Mike Brewer and Edd China do their utmost to get the classic car back on the road.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini checks out a 1933 Duesenberg SJ that has not been taken out on the road for 30 years, and hopes a heated garage has done a good job of keeping the vehicle in top shape.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini flies to Georgia on the orders of a client seeking a 69 ZL-1 Coupe Chevrolet Camaro, and attend the sale of Milt Robson's muscle car collection.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's travel all over America in search of the most interesting, rare and profit-bringing treasures, from old bangers to classic toys.

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: A snowstorm and faulty equipment threatens the freight crew's journey as they race to deliver a heavy load, while in the woods, Jim and Nancy meet an off-grid couple.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A heavy storm causes 20ft-high waves, so most of the fleet heads for home. However, one boat sends out a mayday call, and the coastguard races to save the vessel.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Winter closes in, so the gold dredgers are in a hurry to find more work. Every moment counts, and rivals Shawn and Hank clash over territory.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits the Lambretta Scooter Museum in Weston-super-Mare, and in Walsall, West Midlands, there is a historic haul in one of the UK's last leather factories.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Russell's 30-year-old truck feels the strain on a run from Alice Springs to central Queensland. Meanwhile, Sludge wrestles flooded roads to deliver fuel to farmers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes to France in search of a retro Citroen HY Van, but mechanic Edd China is not impressed with his spoils, knowing it will be a costly renovation.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: American rarities found by Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', featuring items from old bangers to classic toys.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard takes Te up to Wookey Hole, a small village near Somerset, to hunt for stock. Their first stop is the circus museum where Drew hopes to find treasure.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours sites around the UK for potentially valuable scrap items and forgotten remnants.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien arrive in York, where Henry struggles to squeeze into some motorcycle leathers and Simon gets into deep water when he tries to restore an aluminium boat.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The process of fabricating fire gloves for use by emergency services personnel, and the creation of enamel used in bakeware all over the world.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How modern-day objects are created. This time, how islanders of the Outer Hebrides use pedal power to weave Harris tweed, and how fermented shark is prepared.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How scientists traced the murderer of 12-year-old Polly Klaas, who was snatched from her home during a slumber party by a stranger. Laser technology detected a normally invisible palm print, and fibres collected from the scene were eventually matched to the killer, enabling a conviction.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An account of the homebuyer whose survey uncovered a mummified corpse. Plus, events following a sudden rise in the death rate at a hospital, when suspicion fell on its staff.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The case of travelling preacher Anthony Hopkins, who killed his wife after discovering she was abusing his stepdaughter.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murders of Michael and Valerie Miller, shot dead in the kitchen of their Maine home in November 2009. Nathaniel Nightingale, a friend of the couple's son, claimed his gun went off by accident when he shot Michael Miller, and that he shot Valerie in panic.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: When a man is brutally attacked by three armed assailants, bureau investigators are convinced it is the work of the Mafia - even though they are unable to identify the perpetrators.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Mark rescues a dog with open wounds from a crate and firefighters try to reach a cat stuck 40ft up a palm tree in fierce winds.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris takes us into the world of one of Sydney's busiest vets. A labrador is brought in with bulging eyeballs, and 60-year-old tortoise Hugo needs a mate.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Mirjana needs to walk out of the store with a dress that same day, while wedding planner Bethany is looking for a dress to top all others.
